concept.label: first-question
concept.phrase: In the <font color="blue">past</font>, I did the transformation <font color="blue">"%prev_foa2%"</font> when I had <font color="blue">"%prev_foa1%"</font> and got <font color="blue">"%prev_i%"</font> (see <font color="blue">Figure A</font>). <font color="red">Now</font>, I thought performing <font color="red">"%current_foa2%"</font> with <font color="blue">"%current_foa1%"</font> would result in <font color="red">"%current_i%"</font> (see <font color="red">Figure B</font>). Why is this different? Please explain your reasoning in the box below.

concept.label: R2-response-simst
concept.phrase: Fantastic! Thanks!
That's a helpful response. Thanks!
Perfect! You are one of the best teachers I had so far!
Makes perfect sense to me. Thank you!
Genius! That helped a lot!
Sweet! Explanation right on spot!
Thanks for explaining using the key terms. That’s very helpful!

concept.label: R1-response-simst
concept.phrase: I see! Please explain what went wrong.
How did you figure out that something went wrong?
Oh! I see! What inspired you to say that something is wrong?
Got it! By the way, how did you figure out that something went wrong?

concept.label: R0-response-simst
concept.phrase: I am trying to understand why performing <font color="red">"%current_foa2%"</font> with <font color="blue">"%current_foa1%"</font> would not result in <font color="red">"%current_i%"</font>?

I feel like I am missing some crucial information. Can you explain why <font color="red">"%current_foa2%"</font> with <font color="blue">"%current_foa1%"</font> would not result in <font color="red">"%current_i%"</font>?

I attempt to learn things deeply. How did you know that performing <font color="red">"%current_foa2%"</font> with <font color="blue">"%current_foa1%"</font> would not result in <font color="red">"%current_i%"</font>?

I want to solidify my basics. I failed to see why performing <font color="red">"%current_foa2%"</font> with <font color="blue">"%current_foa1%"</font> would not result in <font color="red">"%current_i%"</font>. Can you explain it to me?

I want to strengthen my basic understanding. How did you know that performing <font color="red">"%current_foa2%"</font> with <font color="blue">"%current_foa1%"</font> would not result in <font color="red">"%current_i%"</font>?

concept.label: R0-response-simst-2
concept.phrase: Still no luck for me! Would you try one more time to explain why performing <font color="red">"%current_foa2%"</font> with <font color="blue">"%current_foa1%"</font> would not result in <font color="red">"%current_i%"</font>?

I am still in doubt! Please explain why performing <font color="red">"%current_foa2%"</font> with <font color="blue">"%current_foa1%"</font> would not result in <font color="red">"%current_i%"</font>?

concept.label: move-on
concept.phrase: Tough luck! Let’s move on!
Umm...although I am not entirely sure, let’s move on!
Umm...okay, let’s move on for now!
Although I am not sure what you meant, let’s move on!
Okay! Let’s move on although I’m still confused.

concept.label: unanticipated-response
concept.phrase: anything else
